name: Clin T GIST Small Intestine
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Assign 88 for in situ cases (behavior code /2). TNM does not include an in situ category for GIST small intestine tumors.

**Note 2:**  Give priority to coding depth of invasion or spread outside the small intestine for tumor with intraluminal or lateral extension to adjacent segment(s) of small intestine.

**Note 3:** Tumor size must be known to assign T. You may use a physicianâ€™s statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record.
*    If no size or category is specified, assign TX

**Note 4:** Assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size for the following descriptions

    Invasion of polyp, NOS
    Tumor confined to muscular wall
    Tumor invades through submucosa and muscularis mucosae to involve mucosa
    Intraluminal spread to other segments of small intestine or cecum
    Invasion through muscularis propria or muscularis, NOS
    Extension through wall, NOS
    Subserosal tissue/(sub) serosal fat invaded
    Transmural, NOS

    Adjacent connective tissue
    Mesentery, including mesenteric fat
    Nonperitonealized perimuscular tissue 
    Retroperitoneum 
    Invasion of/through serosa (mesothelium) (tunica serosa) (visceral peritoneum)

**Duodenum primaries (C170)**

    Ampulla of Vater
    Blood vessel(s), major
        Aorta
        Gastroduodenal artery
        Greater omentum
        Portal vein
        Renal vein
        Superior mesenteric artery or vein
        Vena cava
    Diaphragm
    Extrahepatic bile duct(s)
    Gallbladder
    Hepatic flexure
    Kidney (right or NOS)
    Liver (quadrate lobe, right lobe or NOS)
    Omentum
    Pancreas
    Pancreatic duct
    Stomach
    Transverse colon
    Ureter, right

**Jejunum (C171) or Ileum (C172)** 

    Bladder
    Colon, including appendix
    Fallopian tube(s)
    Ovary(ies)
    Uterus
   
    Confined to small intestine
    Localized, NOS
rows:
Clinical classification criteria met, evaluation done: 
    Physician unable to assess T
    Extension cannot be determined 
    Tumor size (TS) unknown for T categories where TS  needed to determine T
Physician assigns cTX, no other information available to determine T
Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 5 cm but not more than 10 cm in greatest dimension
Tumor more than 10 cm in greatest dimension

In situ case but no pTis is defined by TNM
Death certificate only (DCO) case

Clinical classification criteria not met 
Clinical classification criteria met, evaluation done:
    No information about diagnostic workup
    Results not documented in record
Clinical evaluation of primary tumor not done or unknown if done
Tumor first detected on surgical resection (no clinical workup)
Evidence of metastatic disease [(cM1) or (pM1)], no other workup
Only Clinical Stage Group documented (no T, N, or M information available)
